metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6580 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 4.5.103.29, as used in Google Chrome before 45.0.2454.85, allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6580` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu1.1198
chromium-browser-l10n - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu1.1198
chromium-chromedriver - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu1.1198
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu1.1198
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu1.1198
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.9.1-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.9.1-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.9.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu1.1198').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.1-0ubuntu1').
